alert.note: Alert for Blount Smoky Mountains; Loudon; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:43PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Loudon, southwestern Blount and northeastern Monroe Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 642 PM EDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm near Loudon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Reports of pea size hail near I-75. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Loudon, Vonore, Greenback, Philadelphia, Fort Loudon State Park, Citico Beach, McGee Carson Peninsula, Talassee, Tellico Village and Happy Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Blount Smoky Mountains; Loudon; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe
